docs.title: First Steps
docs.text:
Obtain a WiFiCom by either building or buying a premade unit from a reputable maker.

  • DIY Build
  • Buy Premade

Once you have a WiFiCom, you can begin to configure it and connect to your first App.

  • Onboarding a WiFiCom
  • Apps

docs.title: Editable Files
docs.text: These files can be edited, but you must retain the changes between updates. We may introduce breaking changes to these files that are required to run the software. Please be sure to check the release notes for any changes to these files.

docs.title: Files to retain for your notes
w0rld Integration
docs.text: The w0rld development team has now added WiFiCom to the w0rld game. This works for all supported platforms that the game runs on.

docs.title: Subscribe to w0rld
docs.text: Navigate to the w0rld Public App and subscribe w0rld app, visit the following link to find our public apps: Visit Public Apps

docs.title: Obtain Credentials
docs.text:
1. Obtain credentials and subscribe to the w0rld Public App
    1. Obtain your WiFiCom API Key from your WiFiCom User Profile. It will be at the bottom of the page.
      • Select the permissions "device_access" and "application_access" to allow the game to access your WiFiCom device.
    2. Obtain your WiFiCom Device UUID by navigating to your WiFiCom Device List. You may need to click on the WiFiCom device you want to easily copy the UUID.

docs.title: Configure w0rld
docs.text:
1. Open w0rld and login, navigate to the settings menu (Gear icon)
  2. Enable WiFiCom by clicking on the icon
  3. Enter your WiFiCom API Key when prompted
  4. Enter your WiFiCom Device UUID when prompted

docs.title: Play w0rld
docs.text:
1. Ensure your WiFiCom is connected to WiFi (first menu option)
  2. Go ahead and summon as usual, you only need to press the DCom button once now!
  3. You can also battle as usual, at this point your WiFiCom should be working, if not, please check you followed every step (Subscribing to w0rld is required to use WiFiCom in w0rld)

docs.title: Use an A-Com/D-Com
docs.text: Simply uncheck the WiFiCom box in the settings menu to use an A-Com/D-Com

docs.title: Use another WiFiCom
docs.text:
Use the clear buttons in the settings menu to change to a different device

You will likely only need to replace DeviceUUID unless you have multiple WiFiCom accounts
